name: Incline Push-Ups
how_to_perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy platform such as a bench, bar, or step that is at an incline.
2. Place your hands shoulder-width apart on the edge of the elevated surface, keeping your arms straight but not locked.
3. Walk your feet back until your body is in a straight line from head to heels, maintaining a neutral neck position by gazing down.
4. Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine, and keep your body straight.
5. Inhale as you slowly lower your chest towards the edge of the surface by bending your elbows, keeping them at a 45-degree angle to your body.
6. Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the surface or as low as your range of motion allows.
7. Exhale and push through your palms to extend your elbows, lifting your body back to the starting position.
8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining good form and avoiding sagging your hips or arching your back.
short_summary: Incline Push-Ups are a variation of the standard push-up where your hands are elevated on a surface, which makes it easier. This exercise targets the chest, shoulders, and triceps while engaging the core.
